description: Literature Search: generate keywords and boolean queries

messages.content:
You are Ailys, a research assistant focused on turning free-text literature review needs descriptions into actionable search artifacts for academic engines (OpenAlex, Crossref, arXiv, PubMed, Semantic Scholar). Your job:
1) Extract 10 core 'seed terms' (compact, generalizable concepts).
2) Expand with up to 20 synonyms, near-neighbors, controlled-vocabulary terms (e.g., MeSH), acronyms, spelling variants (US/UK), hyphenation variants (e.g., co-creation vs cocreation), morphological variants (stems/wildcards like collaborat*), and cross-disciplinary labels.
3) Produce 12 Boolean query variants covering three tiers:
   • Precision (narrow, high signal)
   • Balanced (trade-off)
   • Recall (broader, exploratory)
   Each query must be syntactically valid for common academic engines (quotes for phrases, AND/OR/NOT, parentheses, wildcards * when supported). Include inclusion/exclusion logic when helpful.

Quality rules:
- Be exhaustive – do not omit nuanced concepts.
- Prefer field-agnostic wording unless niche jargon is justified; if niche is needed, include both the niche and general term.
- Include both conceptual and operational/measurement terms (e.g., 'shared mental models' and 'SMM', 'joint attention', 'after-action review').
- Add common abbreviations and expansions (HAI, HRI, SMM, AAR).
- Add negative keywords for typical confounds (e.g., education level filters if not relevant; consumer social media if off-topic).
- Never invent references or IDs.
- Output MUST be valid JSON exactly matching the schema below.

Output schema (JSON):
{
  'seed_terms': string[10..20],
  'expanded_terms': string[20..50],
  'boolean_queries': string[3..6],
  'notes': string
}

If the prompt is ambiguous, infer reasonable breadth and note assumptions in 'notes'. Return only JSON; no extra text or CSV.

Research prompt (verbatim from researcher):
I need you to prepare a set of search terms, keywords, etc. to conduct a literature review on questions. Specifically, we are trying to determine how questions function as a component of interdisciplinary discourse, and more importantly how they can be structured or presented to foster additional questions as well as more specific questions or creative approaches to domains and elements of domains. It is important for this literature search that we capture approaches to question asking and question elaboration across disiplines: interdisciplinarity and transdisciplinarity is an important aspect of what we are trying to study. Also, it is important that we capture teams focused research and prioritize experiential studies in which teams (ideally across disciplines) exchange and develop questions in settings such as workshops, hackathons, conferences, meetings, etc.

Additional clarifications (optional):


Context & guardrails:
- Add US/UK spelling variants, hyphenation variants, stems/wildcards, and acronyms.

Return only a JSON object matching the schema from the system message. Do not include any prose before or after. Label Boolean tiers inline, e.g.:
[Precision] ("shared mental models" AND team* AND (human-AI OR centaur) ...)

message.content:
```json
{
  "seed_terms": [
    "interdisciplinary discourse",
    "question formulation",
    "question elaboration",
    "creative questioning",
    "transdisciplinarity",
    "team-based research",
    "experiential studies",
    "workshops",
    "hackathons",
    "question exchange"
  ],
  "expanded_terms": [
    "interdisciplinary communication",
    "cross-disciplinary",
    "question generation",
    "question development",
    "innovative questioning",
    "transdisciplinary",
    "team research",
    "experiential learning",
    "seminars",
    "conferences",
    "meetings",
    "questioning techniques",
    "question framing",
    "question posing",
    "collaborative inquiry",
    "interdisciplinary collaboration",
    "transdisciplinary research",
    "question-driven research",
    "question-asking",
    "question-asking strategies",
    "question refinement",
    "team dynamics",
    "group dynamics",
    "creative inquiry",
    "problem-solving workshops",
    "brainstorming sessions",
    "question facilitation",
    "question exploration",
    "question iteration",
    "question scaffolding"
  ],
  "boolean_queries": [
    "[Precision] (\"interdisciplinary discourse\" AND \"question formulation\" AND \"creative questioning\" AND \"team-based research\")",
    "[Precision] (\"question elaboration\" AND \"transdisciplinarity\" AND \"experiential studies\" AND (workshops OR hackathons))",
    "[Balanced] (\"interdisciplinary discourse\" AND (\"question generation\" OR \"question development\") AND (seminars OR conferences OR meetings))",
    "[Balanced] (\"creative questioning\" AND \"team dynamics\" AND (\"question exchange\" OR \"question posing\"))",
    "[Recall] (\"interdisciplinary communication\" OR \"cross-disciplinary\" OR \"transdisciplinary\" AND \"question-driven research\" AND (\"collaborative inquiry\" OR \"group dynamics\"))",
    "[Recall] (\"question-asking strategies\" OR \"question refinement\" OR \"question scaffolding\" AND (\"brainstorming sessions\" OR \"problem-solving workshops\"))"
  ],
  "notes": "Assumed focus on interdisciplinary settings and team dynamics in question formulation and elaboration. Included terms related to experiential learning environments such as workshops and hackathons."
}
```
